More Actions Andrew has a account Andrew Meister Large Cap Equity Research Analyst at Thrivent Asset Management Thrivent Asset Management University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire Oshkosh, Wisconsin Area 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Even as a kid, I have been interested in risk versus reward scenarios and expected value calculations, although I didn’t know it at the time. Perhaps it came from my father teaching me how to play poker at age 6 or from handicapping football games in high school? I have spent 20 years in equity research. The first 10 years were at sell-side firms Robert Baird and Stifel Nicolaus and the remaining 10 years at Thrivent Asset Management. My work experience on the sell-side built my skills in financial modeling and company research. In addition, I learned the softer skills of report writing and communicating concisely and accurately with buyside customers. It was on the sell-side that learned the importance of delivering impeccable client service. I also learned how to deliver an outstanding investor conference experience helping present Baird’s Industrial conference in Chicago. My career experience at Baird and Stifel focused my research efforts on the Industrial and Transportation sectors, which I now consider myself expert in. The training and encouragement I received was exceptional and I am grateful to both firms and the individuals I worked with closely. At Thrivent, I focus on asset selection in a relative performance framework. Thrivent is process driven and I have refined my industry analysis, stock picking, idea generation, and valuation to be more consistent and repeatable. I presently work with a passionate team of talented investment professionals. A career aspiration is to be in the top 10% of analysts in the broader Industrial sector. I also have an entrepreneurial streak. In 1998, I co-founded a business that sought to connect industry experts with investors. In 2008, I helped fund Nth Penguin, a software consultancy. In 2005, through 2 satellite tournaments, I qualified for the World Series of Poker main event. I finished 334th that year and cashed! Additionally, I still enjoy playing golf, having played since age 14. More Actions Jennifer N. has a account Jennifer N. Coombs Associate Professor at College for Financial Planning, Founder & President of GradMoney College for Financial Planning Clarkson University Denver, Colorado 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Coombs is an Associate Professor at the College for Financial Planning, and is the lead instructor for the Chartered Mutual Fund Counselor (CMFC) and the Accredited Asset Management Specialist (AAMS) designation courses. Additionally, she is the Founder & President of GradMoney. Org: an investing education platform directed at simplifying the stock analysis process for young adults and novice investors. Prior to relocating to Colorado, Jennifer served as the Head of Campus Outreach and Contributor Acquisition Manager for Seeking Alpha in New York City. Additionally, she worked as a Senior Equity Research Analyst at Wall Street Strategies, Inc. where she was responsible for the technical and fundamental analysis of the entire stock market for recommendations to individual investors, while also publishing daily economic commentary for the general public. Prior to this, she worked on the buy side as an Associate Equity Research Analyst covering the transportation sub-sector of industrials at AIG SunAmerica Asset Management Corporation. Jennifer also covered Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) and has done broader research in the industrial, financial and consumer sectors. Prior to joining their research department, she worked as a Trading Assistant, actively responsible for SunAmerica's index funds valued at over $7 billion. Additionally, she also worked as an intern in the client portfolio management department at Dwight Asset Management Company - a fixed income subsidiary of Goldman Sachs. Jennifer graduated with distinction (cum laude) from Clarkson University where she earned a B.S. with majors in Financial Information Analysis and Political Science, with minors in Economics and Law. She also has a unique knowledge of international markets, and studied at Sungkyunkwan University in South Korea. Jennifer is a former member of the New York Society of Security Analysts and is a current member of the Financial Planning Association (FPA) of Colorado. Prior to relocating to Colorado, Jennifer served as the Head of Campus Outreach and Contributor Acquisition Manager for Seeking Alpha in New York City. Additionally, she worked as a Senior Equity Research Analyst at Wall Street Strategies, Inc. where she was responsible for the technical and fundamental analysis of the entire stock market for recommendations to individual investors, while also publishing daily economic commentary for the general public. Prior to this, she worked on the buy side as an Associate Equity Research Analyst covering the transportation sub-sector of industrials at AIG SunAmerica Asset Management Corporation. Jennifer also covered Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) and has done broader research in the industrial, financial and consumer sectors. Prior to joining their research department, she worked as a Trading Assistant, actively responsible for SunAmerica's index funds valued at over $7 billion. Additionally, she also worked as an intern in the client portfolio management department at Dwight Asset Management Company - a fixed income subsidiary of Goldman Sachs. Jennifer graduated with distinction (cum laude) from Clarkson University where she earned a B.S. with majors in Financial Information Analysis and Political Science, with minors in Economics and Law. She also has a unique knowledge of international markets, and studied at Sungkyunkwan University in South Korea. Jennifer is a former member of the New York Society of Security Analysts and is a current member of the Financial Planning Association (FPA) of Colorado. More Actions Oliver has a premium account Click to upgrade to Premium 3rd degree connection3rd Oliver Chen, CFA Retailing/Specialty Stores Softlines, Retailing/Broadlines & Department Store, and Luxury Analyst Cowen and Company University of Pennsylvania - The Wharton School Greater New York City Area 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Oliver Chen has joined Cowen and Company’s Equity Research department as a Managing Director and Senior Equity Research Analyst. He covers the Specialty Retail, Broadlines & Department stores, and Luxury sectors. Oliver is a graduate of Georgetown University, The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and is a CFA Charterholder. He also serves on the PhD Retail Research Review committee at the Wharton School's Jay H. Baker Retailing Center. The 2014 All-America Research Team: Retailing/Specialty Stores, No. 3: Oliver Chen "Oliver Chen continues to rise in buy-siders’ esteem. The Citi analyst earned designation as a Rising Star of Wall Street Research in 2012, merited a runner-up position on this roster last year and now advances to capture third place. He “knows the accessories, luxury goods, watches and handbag markets better than anyone else, given his passion for retail and creativity,” one fund manager observes. Adds a second backer: Chen “just knows what’s cool and what will sell at full price.” For his part, the researcher is advising investors to favor accessories over apparel. “We believe strong accessory brands with brawn have greater pricing leverage and full-price selling, which drives a stronger return on equity versus apparel,” he explains. In March, Chen upgraded New York–based jewelry retailer Tiffany & Co. from neutral to buy, convinced that new management and design teams would deliver same-store sales growth. Indeed, comparable outlets delivered a year-over-year increase of 7 percent during the fiscal first half, ended July 31, and by mid-September the stock had climbed 10.1 percent, to $100.71, besting the sector by 5.9 percentage points." Keywords: Fundamental Research, Valuation, Financial Modeling; Proprietary Channel Checks and Competitive Analysis. Equity research analyst, Sell-side, Analyst covering, Buy-side, Investment recommendations, fundamental analysis, institutional investors, equity analyst, valuation analysis. Hunt Ranks #407 on Fortune 500 List John liked GlobalTranz Announces Acquisition of Worthington Logistics Solutions John liked Through participating and leading my trade association, I have experience testifying in Congress and meeting members of Congress, Senators and staffers. Spent two days on Capitol Hill this week. Today's shooting shook many to the core. I'm concerned that we are losing our civility and blurring lines that should never blur. Being a good American requires us to tolerate and and seek to learn from other peoples' opinions. You certainly don't need to agree. Violence and hatred are never appropriate. Members of Congress are so afraid to talk to the other party, it is crippling our nation. Far right and far left PAC-funded groups target you if you reach across the aisle and seek moderation and compromise. Far left and right protestors seek permits to demonstrate in front of Members' homes. Occasionally, crazies go to extremes. Madness. We can teach our children that there is news and news with opinion. The same goes for tweets and blogs. Opinions may lean left or right, or worse. Democrats, Republicans and Independents have to work together to solve issues the same way everybody else in the world does--by talking and finding common ground, and giving a little. Nobody gets everything he or she wants. Let's solve some problems. More Actions Philip has a account Philip Winslow, CFA Equity Research Analyst (Software) at Wells Fargo Securities Wells Fargo Securities The Wharton School New York, New York 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Philip Winslow is a Managing Director of Wells Fargo Securities, based in New York. Coordinating a team of five research professionals across the United States, Mr. Winslow serves as the head of the software team in the Research & Economics department. Mr. Winslow has consistently been ranked in the Top 10 in Intuitional Investor magazine's All-America Research Team since 2008 (including five years ranked runner-up or higher) and has also been recognized in Bloomberg Markets magazine's Top U.S. Analysts survey. He also ranks in the top decile of more than 4,000 analysts tracked by TipRanks across all sectors. Prior to joining Wells Fargo Securities, Mr. Winslow served as a Managing Director of Credit Suisse in the Investment Banking division, based in New York. Coordinating a team of nine research professionals across the United States and Europe, Mr. Winslow acted as the global head of the software team in the Equity Research department. He originally joined the Technology Group of Credit Suisse First Boston in June 2002 as an associate, covering the Internet infrastructure software sector. Mr. Winslow graduated from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania in May 2001. He is a CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) charterholder. Hunt Ranks #407 on Fortune 500 List John liked GlobalTranz Announces Acquisition of Worthington Logistics Solutions John liked Through participating and leading my trade association, I have experience testifying in Congress and meeting members of Congress, Senators and staffers. Spent two days on Capitol Hill this week. Today's shooting shook many to the core. I'm concerned that we are losing our civility and blurring lines that should never blur. Being a good American requires us to tolerate and and seek to learn from other peoples' opinions. You certainly don't need to agree. Violence and hatred are never appropriate. Members of Congress are so afraid to talk to the other party, it is crippling our nation. Far right and far left PAC-funded groups target you if you reach across the aisle and seek moderation and compromise. Far left and right protestors seek permits to demonstrate in front of Members' homes. Occasionally, crazies go to extremes. Madness. We can teach our children that there is news and news with opinion. The same goes for tweets and blogs. Opinions may lean left or right, or worse. Democrats, Republicans and Independents have to work together to solve issues the same way everybody else in the world does--by talking and finding common ground, and giving a little. Nobody gets everything he or she wants. Let's solve some problems. More Actions Philip has a account Philip Winslow, CFA Equity Research Analyst (Software) at Wells Fargo Securities Wells Fargo Securities The Wharton School New York, New York 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Philip Winslow is a Managing Director of Wells Fargo Securities, based in New York. Coordinating a team of five research professionals across the United States, Mr. Winslow serves as the head of the software team in the Research & Economics department. Mr. Winslow has consistently been ranked in the Top 10 in Intuitional Investor magazine's All-America Research Team since 2008 (including five years ranked runner-up or higher) and has also been recognized in Bloomberg Markets magazine's Top U.S. Analysts survey. He also ranks in the top decile of more than 4,000 analysts tracked by TipRanks across all sectors. Prior to joining Wells Fargo Securities, Mr. Winslow served as a Managing Director of Credit Suisse in the Investment Banking division, based in New York. Coordinating a team of nine research professionals across the United States and Europe, Mr. Winslow acted as the global head of the software team in the Equity Research department. He originally joined the Technology Group of Credit Suisse First Boston in June 2002 as an associate, covering the Internet infrastructure software sector. Mr. Winslow graduated from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania in May 2001. He is a CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) charterholder. More Actions Heather Q. has a account Heather Q. Li Equity Research Associate at HSBC HSBC New York University - Leonard N. Stern School of Business Hong Kong 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Highlights Follow Follow Heather Q.’s Activity 650 followers It's ironic that I was a horrible interviewee and now I'm inside the recruiting industry in addition to being a business owner of an agency. I have been passed up for not interviewing like a pro even though I knew I had the experience and transferable skill sets needed to exceed the companies expectations. If you interview candidates like they are guilty of a crime and you have a ego - arrogance - position of power that is used to interrogate a candidate - you don't deserve to be part of the interview loop and should remind yourself of the time you were once a candidate and how you would of preferred to be treated. In your opinion what are the alternatives towards improving how we welcome candidates and conduct conversation about the job opportunities vs basing it on who can interview the best? Great interviews does not result into great hires as studies have shown although it is one indicator and deciding factors. Stern School of Business Hong Kong 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Highlights Follow Follow Heather Q.’s Activity 650 followers It's ironic that I was a horrible interviewee and now I'm inside the recruiting industry in addition to being a business owner of an agency. I have been passed up for not interviewing like a pro even though I knew I had the experience and transferable skill sets needed to exceed the companies expectations. If you interview candidates like they are guilty of a crime and you have a ego - arrogance - position of power that is used to interrogate a candidate - you don't deserve to be part of the interview loop and should remind yourself of the time you were once a candidate and how you would of preferred to be treated. In your opinion what are the alternatives towards improving how we welcome candidates and conduct conversation about the job opportunities vs basing it on who can interview the best? Great interviews does not result into great hires as studies have shown although it is one indicator and deciding factors. Currently I am pursuing my CFA level 1. After receiving my degree I intend to work at an investment firm doing equity research. Besides school, I have been learning a lot about value investing and have been applying the value investing approach to the stock market by investing my own money in long term securities. I am always on the lookout for a wide variety of investment opportunities, ranging from slow-growth and cyclical companies to asset plays and turnarounds. Before making the final decision to invest real money in any of the businesses I take interest in, I conduct thorough investigative research on each company and document all of my findings. These reports contain information on the company's financial standing, their leadership team, current market conditions, and any other pieces of information that are relevant to the company's financial health and future outlook. More Actions Dominic has a premium account Click to upgrade to Premium Dominic Azoulay Summer Equity Research Analyst | CFA Level I Candidate | Finance Major at San Francisco State University Phocas Financial San Francisco State University, College of Business Mountain View, California 497 497 connections InMail I am an extremely disciplined and goal orientated college student currently studying at San Francisco State and majoring in Business Finance. Currently I am pursuing my CFA level 1. After receiving my degree I intend to work at an investment firm doing equity research. Besides school, I have been learning a lot about value investing and have been applying the value investing approach to the stock market by investing my own money in long term securities. I am always on the lookout for a wide variety of investment opportunities, ranging from slow-growth and cyclical companies to asset plays and turnarounds. Before making the final decision to invest real money in any of the businesses I take interest in, I conduct thorough investigative research on each company and document all of my findings. These reports contain information on the company's financial standing, their leadership team, current market conditions, and any other pieces of information that are relevant to the company's financial health and future outlook. Highlights Experience Sr. Research Analyst - Technology Company Name Piper Jaffray Dates Employed Jul 2001 – Present Employment Duration 16 yrs Mike Olson is a managing director and senior research analyst at Piper Jaffray covering consumer technology & eCommerce. Olson has been with Piper Jaffray covering companies in these industries since 2001 and has authored numerous industry reports, including "Sharing Economy: An In-Depth Look At the Evolution & Trajectory Across Industries," and "The Next Leg of Online Travel." Olson was recognized as the No. 2 earnings estimator in the 2015 Thomson Reuters / StarMine Internet & Catalog Retail category and was ranked in the 2010 Wall Street Journal "Best On The Street" for the Leisure Goods & Services category. Olson holds a bachelor's degree in finance, investment and banking from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. My experience with her evaluating healthcare stocks for investment was that her research was deep, her insights accurate, and her investment recommendations most often on the mark. If I had to use a single word to describe Eileen’s work as an equity research analyst, that word would be thorough. Many of Eileen’s colleagues in the equity research community would rely on the opinions of others to form the basis of their own views. Never Eileen. She approached each investment opportunity with a blank page and worked to develop her own understanding that was rooted in a strong knowledge of the company, its industry, its financials, its team, its products and its strategy. With such deep analysis in hand, Eileen could then make an investment recommendation with confidence. Because she knew her stories cold, inevitable market downdrafts presented opportunity rather than anxiety. Eileen’s intelligence, inquisitive personality and capacity for hard work directly led to many attractive equity investment opportunities. She’s a terrific corporate and investment analyst, and a great professional. Jack was a great leader for Leerink and I was sorry to see him leave the firm. More Actions Troy has a account Troy Marchand Managing Partner & Founder at Foundry Capital Group Foundry Capital Group Indiana University - Kelley School of Business Indianapolis, Indiana Area 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Foundry Capital Group is the manager of the Foundry Mezzanine Opportunity Fund, LP and the Foundry Value Fund, LP. The Value Fund seeks to identify stocks with a large margin of safety, while identifying potential catalysts to unlock hidden value. We employ an opportunistic special situations and deep value-oriented framework. The Mezzanine Fund looks to invest opportunistically in private loans to small businesses, while being strong partners to the businesses we provide capital. Our mandate is very wide and includes, bridge loans, merchant cash advances, factoring receivables, PO financing, preferred equity, convertible bonds, etc. Disclosure: This is not an advertisement or solicitation to sell anything. The fund only accepts investments from accredited investors. My experience with her evaluating healthcare stocks for investment was that her research was deep, her insights accurate, and her investment recommendations most often on the mark. If I had to use a single word to describe Eileen’s work as an equity research analyst, that word would be thorough. Many of Eileen’s colleagues in the equity research community would rely on the opinions of others to form the basis of their own views. Never Eileen. She approached each investment opportunity with a blank page and worked to develop her own understanding that was rooted in a strong knowledge of the company, its industry, its financials, its team, its products and its strategy. With such deep analysis in hand, Eileen could then make an investment recommendation with confidence. Because she knew her stories cold, inevitable market downdrafts presented opportunity rather than anxiety. Eileen’s intelligence, inquisitive personality and capacity for hard work directly led to many attractive equity investment opportunities. She’s a terrific corporate and investment analyst, and a great professional. More Actions Scott has a account Scott Kessler Director of Equity Research with CFRA (formerly S&P Global Market Intelligence) CFRA Research Washington University in St. Louis School of Law New York, New York 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail I'm a high-energy and experienced manager and fundamental equity and industry analyst. Since 1995, I've professionally focused on themes, issues and companies in and related to the Technology, Media and Telecommunications (TMT) areas. My experience includes more than 18 years in equity research, as well as time as a private regulatory attorney and an adviser on Capitol Hill. I've covered industries, companies and stocks in/around the Technology Sector since 1998, with an emphasis on Internet, Software and Services names, and the Financial Technology (Fintech) area. I've received internal and external accolades for my efforts and achievements, enjoy regular communications with clients, and am frequently featured by major media outlets. I started leading the Technology Sector team in 2004, and became Deputy Director of what was known as S&P Global Market Intelligence's (formerly S&P Capital IQ) Equity Research business in 2014. In September 2016, CFRA announced the proposed acquisition of the Equity Research and Fund Research business of S&P Global Market Intelligence. The deal closed soon thereafter. Disclosure: This is a personal LinkedIn profile, and isn't intended to represent anyone or anything other than Scott Kessler and his individual information and views. I was awarded more than 40 software industry corporate finance mandates and was directly involved in IPO and M&A transactions with a collective value of >$43 BB. ➤ My experience as a founder has provided me with firsthand knowledge of the challenges associated with scaling operations for high-growth businesses. More recently, as a finance executive, I have partnered with executive teams to enhance financial planning, streamline sales forecasting, initiate operational analytics, implement treasury operations, introduce risk controls, and build out high caliber finance teams. ➤ Having been directly involved in raising >$275 MM of debt and equity, I have an appreciation for the deliverables, expectations, and timeline associated with the process of attracting investments from leading VC, private equity, and crossover growth investors. I have implemented the investor relations functions required for a privately-held company and made preparations for a public market debut. ➤ I thrive on addressing the challenges associated with scaling operations at high growth businesses and working with world-class teams to produce successful outcomes. Partner & Sr Equity Research Analyst Company Name Maple Leaf Partners, LP Dates Employed Nov 2002 – Dec 2011 Employment Duration 9 yrs 2 mos Location Baton Rouge, Louisiana Area Maple Leaf Partners is an equity hedge fund firm founded by Dane Andreeff in 1996. Ryan joined Maple Leaf in November 2002 as the first equity research analyst. In January 2003, Julian Robertson's Tiger Management became a strategic investor in Maple Leaf.Ryan was responsible generating investment reccomendations for the firm's portfolios in the Technology, Consumer and Industrial sectors. As a Sr. Equity Research Analyst he performed in-depth financial analysis, interviewed company management teams, built robust financial forecasting models and became an expert on dozens of companies. As the firm grew rapidly from 2003-2008, he also developed systems and processes that allowed the firm to scale to over $2 billion in assets. In 2009 Ryan became a Partner in the firm. More Actions Kevin has a account Kevin Kerdoudi Equity Research Analyst at Bank of America Merrill Lynch Bank of America Merrill Lynch ESCP Europe London, United Kingdom 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail In late July 2012, I decided to hike in the South-West of France with a friend - 140 km in 6 days. It was easy at the beginning. However the rain and cold temperature alternating with the ruthlessness of the sun caused pain as well as physical and mental fatigue. Every time I saw someone with a car I repeatedly thought about returning to Paris. Nevertheless I kept going further into my adventure. This is who I am. I use this proven tenacity and strong will in my roles in commodities businesses at BofAML. It may not be as painful as my hiking holidays, but it is exceedingly challenging and I adore it! I have discovered roles where I can combine my interests in financial markets, geopolitics, entrepreneurship and strategy with my personal skills: analysis, networking as well as communication. If you are interested in having a coffee to talk about commodities or potential ways to collaborate whatsoever (or hiking), please feel free to contact me. More Actions Jeff has a account Jeff Kvaal Managing Director, Communications Equity Research at Nomura Securities Nomura Securities Columbia Business School New York, New York 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Jeff is a veteran of the mobile, data center, and communications technology markets. He has most recently advised the CEO of MusicQubed, a mobile music startup in the UK, on its financial planning and fundraising processes. His tenure as an equity research analyst at Lehman Brothers and Barclays Capital allowed him to develop particular insight into the cellphone, communications equipment, and data networking industries. This includes a wide range of US and global companies both public and private. Over the years, Jeff has built a strong franchise with key decision makers among the institutional investor community, which has led to recognition in many external polls. See moreSee more of undefined summary Highlights Experience Managing Director Company Name Nomura Securities Dates Employed May 2015 – Present Employment Duration 2 yrs 2 mos Location New York Jeff leads the US Communications team for Nomura Securities. His purview includes oversight of the telecom services, smartphones, and communications equipment industries. His 15 year tenure allows him to offer nuanced counsel to institutional investors and company managements. His experience has included wide swathes of the communications markets, numerous economic cycles, the births of many new public companies, and the transition of companies from high growth to value. His professional accolades include top rankings from the Wall Street Journal and Greenwich Associates. He was a top ranked analyst for Institutional Investor in multiple sectors for six years. Consultant to the CEO, Advisory Board Member Company Name MusicQubed Dates Employed Sep 2013 – Mar 2016 Employment Duration 2 yrs 7 mos Location New York MusicQubed is a fast growing UK mobile music company. Jeff was a consultant for the company over a six month engagement. He built MusicQubed's financial plan to support growth beyond its core UK market into 25 new countries and developed a KPI dashboard to mark progress. In addition, Jeff helped positioned MusicQubed's story for outside investors. At the conclusion of his project, MusicQubed placed him on the Advisory Board where he assisted with financial planning, strategic positioning, business development, and fundraising. Senior Research Analyst, Data Center Infrastructure Company Name Northland Securities Dates Employed Mar 2014 – May 2015 Employment Duration 1 yr 3 mos Location Greater New York City Area Jeff was a Senior Research Analyst for Northland's Equities practice. He brought 15 years of expertise in the TMT sector, including Mobility, Communications Equipment, and Networking. His tenure and depth of knowledge provided a wide roster of unique insights into trends and inflection points in TMT. His expertise with the financial markets allowed him to quickly distill these themes to crisp and coherent investment ideas. These skills allowed Jeff to offer insight to institutional investors, public company executives, and emerging private companies, among others. He had lead coverage of the Wireless Equipment and Data Networking sectors. His coverage roster spanned up to 35 companies. The large cap coverage included Cisco, Juniper, F5, Nortel, Ericsson, Nokia, BlackBerry, and QUALCOMM. Jeff's contributions led to to numerous accolades from external publications such as the WSJ and Greenwich Associates. He was a top ranked analyst in the Institutional Investor poll for six consecutive years. He rose to lead coverage of the Wireless Equipment and Data Networking sectors after several years of small cap coverage. In his early years at Lehman, he served as the lead associate for the well regarded semiconductor and communications analyst Tim Luke. His years of experience have given him a unique ability to see distinct patterns in the evolution of various technology cycles and corporate behavior before they become apparent to most in order to assess potential investing opportunities and/or avoid potential pitfalls. This ability, earned through the combination of his own keen intellect and years of working with hundreds of companies (if not more) has enabled him to serve as trusted counsel for various institutional investors (both public and private) and executives from across the corporate spectrum (domestic and international, start up and established). The combination of an exceptionally diligent work ethic, a highly analytic mind and the ability to distill and communicate complex issues into understandable ideas alone are enough to separate him from others in the industry. However, I believe it is his willingness to go the extra mile (or ten) to support all of those around him – be they subordinates or colleagues – and his core ethics that truly defines his differentiating qualities as a manager and colleague. More Actions Anthony has a account Anthony Noto Twitter COO & CFO Twitter The Wharton School Atherton, California 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Anthony Noto became COO of Twitter in November 2016 and remains the company's CFO. Prior to joining Twitter in July 2014 he was the co-head of Global Telecommunications, Media and Technology (TMT) Investment Banking at Goldman Sachs. He rejoined Goldman Sachs in October 2010 after serving as the National Football League’s executive vice president and chief financial officer for nearly three years. While at the NFL, Anthony oversaw league-wide finance and strategy functions, including corporate development, labor finance, operational finance and accounting, tax and treasury. Prior to joining the NFL, Anthony was the Internet, Entertainment and Cable Equity Research analyst and business unit leader for the Communications, Media and Entertainment Equity Research team at Goldman Sachs. Anthony joined the firm in 1999 in Equity Research to cover the Internet sector and added coverage of the Entertainment sector in 2003. He was a top-ranked analyst in both the Internet and Entertainment sectors in the annual Institutional Investor poll and Greenwich Survey from his first year covering each sector. Anthony also achieved the distinction of being the No. 1 ranked Internet analyst from 2003 to 2007. He was named managing director in 2003 and partner in 2004. Prior to first joining Goldman Sachs, Anthony worked at Lehman Brothers, where he was part of the Institutional Investor All-American Team covering the Broadline Retailing sector. Before transitioning to equity research, Anthony was a brand manager at Kraft Foods, Incorporated and a captain in the US Army as a telecommunications officer. She has been ranked as an Institutional Investor (II) analyst (2014 and 2012) and recognized by the Wall Street Journal as a Best on the Street Analyst (2010). In addition, she is a frequent presenter on television, including on Squawk Box, Squawk Alley, and Bloomberg. She has also been rated as one of the top 50 most influential people in EMS by Venture Outsourcing (2012). Sherri joined Deutsche Bank in 2002 as an Associate Analyst covering the IT Hardware and Storage industries, and was promoted to Senior Analyst in 2007. She holds an MBA from Columbia Business School as well as master’s and bachelor’s degrees in Architecture. She has been ranked as an Institutional Investor (II) analyst (2014 and 2012) and recognized by the Wall Street Journal as a Best on the Street Analyst (2010). She holds an MBA from Columbia Business School as well as master’s and bachelor’s degrees in Architecture. More Actions Alex has a account 3rd degree connection3rd Alex Bossert Founder at Bossert Capital Bossert Capital University of Minnesota - Carlson School of Management Curtis L. Carlson School of Management University of Minnesota Greater Minneapolis-St. Paul Area 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail I started Bossert Capital in February of 2017 to invest money on behalf of a select group of long-term oriented, business minded, wealthy families and individuals. I invest primarily in equities. I am a value investor with a long-term focus. I invest with an ownership mentality and view a stock as a percentage ownership in a business. I seek investments in industries that I understand and I patiently wait for opportunities to buy businesses at a large discount to my estimate of their intrinsic value. I began investing my own money at 10 years old. Some of the investors I admire are Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Benjamin Graham, Joel Greenblatt, Seth Klarman, Mohnish Pabrai, Guy Spier and others. Prior to starting Bossert Capital, I held analyst roles at multiple investment firms. From 2010 – 2013 I was an analyst at Milestone Capital, a value focused investment firm based in Minneapolis, Minnesota. In 2013, I completed an internship at Fidelity Investments where I was one of five interns selected out of a pool of over 2,000 candidates and worked directly with the fund managers at Fidelity. From 2014 – 2017, I was an analyst at Granite House Capital Management. Knowledge compounds just like money can. I welcome any opportunity to connect with thoughtful individuals who are passionate about what they do. In 2014, I was accepted as a member of the Value Investors Club. I am also the youngest ever admitted member of the SumZero buyside network. I was one of 14 buyside analysts in the nation to be named to the 2012 SumZero Buyside Analyst Honors which was published in the Wall Street Journal and CNBC. Over 8,000 analysts were considered. I was also featured in the biography of investor Warren Buffett in “Of Permanent Value: The Story Of Warren Buffett.” I maintain a blog called “Alex Bossert‘s Thoughts On Value Investing” with over 450 subscribers and over 250,000 site views. More Actions Sean has a premium account Click to upgrade to Premium Sean Stannard-Stockton, CFA President & Chief Investment Officer, focused investment portfolios for individuals, families & charitable organizations Ensemble Capital Management University of California, Davis Burlingame, California 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Sean is president and chief investment officer of Ensemble Capital Management. He is also the portfolio manager of the Ensemble Fund, a publicly traded mutual fund. Ensemble Capital builds focused investment portfolios to help you preserve your success and enhance your future. Our principled and rigorous investment process offers a history of superior performance for individuals, families, trusts, foundations and nonprofits. We believe that investors are best served by owning a portfolio of companies, both emerging and established, that have significant growth opportunities and competitive advantages that allow them to sustain their profitability while returning capital to shareholders over time. Rather than trying to guess which way the market or certain stocks may move in reaction to short-term news, we look to participate in the profitability of companies that will achieve superior long-term corporate performance. We are business analysts, not stock market pundits. We spend our time learning as much as possible about the industry trends, competitive dynamics and customer demands that give rise to intrinsically valuable companies. Sean is the author, along with a number of Ensemble Capital colleagues, of the Intrinsic Investing blog. While our main efforts are concentrated on investment research and portfolio management, we also have developed special expertise in philanthropic planning. Sean is well known in the philanthropic community for his popular Tactical Philanthropy blog that he authored from 2006 to 2011 as well as his regular columns in the Financial Times and Chronicle of Philanthropy. During his time as a blogger and columnist he was a sought after public speaker and was regularly quoted in such media outlets as The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Washington Post, and National Public Radio. Before joining Ensemble Capital, he was a member of a private client advisor team working with high net-worth individuals at Scudder Investments. More Actions Trace has a account Trace Urdan Managing Director at Credit Suisse Credit Suisse Harvard Business School San Francisco Bay Area 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Trace Urdan is a Managing Director and Senior Analyst at Credit Suisse covering the Knowledge Services sector. After holding senior management positions within Time Inc. and KPMG Media Marwick, Mr. Urdan began his career as a research analyst in 1998 with Alex. Brown & Sons, covering publishing and education. Since that time he has held senior education research positions at a number of firms including ThinkEquity, Robert W. Baird, Signal Hill Capital Group and most recently Wells Fargo Securities. Trace is widely-cited as an expert on the topics of for-profit education, education technology and education policy. In 2011 he authored a white paper for the Kauffman Foundation on the topic of higher education regulation. In 2008 he was cited by Career College Central magazine as one of the 25 most influential people in the career college sector. In 2005 Trace was invited to testify before the Spellings Commission on the Future of Higher Education. He has been cited as an All-Star analyst by the Wall Street Journal. Trace received a BA degree from Yale University and an MBA from Harvard Business School. While I will continue to serve the company as Senior Advisor, I am open to any conversations, referrals or business ideas you may have. Thanks in advance. Trace liked Trace liked a comment Calling all Edtech Startups! The NYU Edtech Accelerator, powered by StartEd, works with innovative startups focused on technology solutions to improve education and learning -- across all stages from birth through lifelong learning. Each of the ten companies selected for the program will receive up to $170,000 in funding. Apply by the early deadline, June 30, 2017: https://lnkd.in/duYk666 FAQs: https://lnkd.in/ds6DqRt The intensive three-month mentor-led Accelerator is housed at the NYU Edtech Incubator, a co-working space dedicated to education entrepreneurship on NYU’s campus in New York City. More Actions Gretchen has a account Gretchen Espejo International Assignments Tax Analyst at IBM IBM Business Services Inc University of Santo Tomas Philippines 3 3 connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent Highlights Follow Follow Gretchen’s Activity 3 followers ~THE INTERVIEWEE WHO HATED ME~ 6 years ago a guy looked at me face to face, and boldly told me; "I don't like you!" I replied: Thank you for the feedback, but those you like - has it made their life better? Does your liking people pay their bills? Today I joined a CEO friend of mine in an interview Panel. As we returned from a break to continue the interviews this same guy walked in. Our eyes met and we recognized each other. He felt uncomfortable through out the interview. I allowed everyone to take their turn and interviewed him last. I said I LIKE YOU so much. You look to me like an intelligent person, but it seems you are not comfortable? That's correct Sir, He said. I replied, I was never offended or bothered that day because whether you liked me or not was inconsequential. I beckoned him to embrace me. Everyone was wondering if we had recast an interview to a Hollywood movie scene. He hugged me. I said "now get your confidence back and answer the questions like the Pro Shark you are. We burst into laughter, everyone suddenly liked him and well to cut the story short he got the job! If you dislike someone, it is YOUR FAULT! Learn to forgive, overlook people's dislike for you, bless them rather - that's how you court God's blessings, favour and protection. More Actions Akanksha has a account Akanksha Chopra Attended Jamia Millia Islamia Sharekhan Jamia Millia Islamia New Delhi Area, India 39 39 connections Send InMail Highlights Follow Follow Akanksha’s Activity 39 followers Chat fictions are here to save the bibliophile in you Akanksha liked I see a lot of entrepreneurs reading interviews and transcripts of competitive founders or those who are market leaders and shaping their strategy. The key is to read between the lines and understand what they are not saying. Imitating them wont give you an edge, knowing what they are avoiding, might give you insights into what you can become better at. Remember, nobody cares for a local version of an awesome brand. Akanksha liked Can we stop calling companies tech companies now? If you make great pizza and have a website, you are a pizza company not a tech company. If you make amazing shoes helped by 3D printers, you are still not a tech company. If you make all your money from selling advertising you are a media company, regardless of the technology you use. You are probably not a "tech company that happens to sell coffee". Companies now operate in what's best called "the modern world". Using digital stuff is like using electricity, it's just required for 2017. So unless you make money from making technology, please accept "being a tech company" is silly. It's great rhetoric, but it's now empty and nothing to boast about. Akanksha liked An entrepreneur once asked me. "Can we get iMacs in the office (with the funding we are about to close?) "Hmm, no. But you can with the revenue you make". They made revenue. They got their Macs. Perks are fine, but ultimately you want to build a high yield org, for that incentives need to be aligned. Have that culture built in from day one. Akanksha liked Hi Folks!! Urgent Hiring for Research Analyst. Exp-0-2 yrs, Salary- 20-50K, MBA/PGDM, Gurgaon, Delhi, Noida etc. Like & comment if you are intersted. Portfolio Manager Company Name Fidelity Investments Dates Employed Jan 2009 – May 2016 Employment Duration 7 yrs 5 mos • Managed concentrated, sector-specific portfolios in the technology, telecommunications, and consumer sectors as part of Fidelity’s multi-manager efforts. Employed a Growth At A Reasonable Price style with a disciplined approach to risk management and portfolio construction. • Emphasized owning higher quality companies with above average growth potential, solid business models across a cycle, defendable market positions, and value creating management teams, most of which were undervalued on a P/CF basis with catalysts to unlock value.• Combined complementary quantitative research with my fundamental approach to further identify opportunities and risks and to best understand which factors have proven to be most successful in my universe over time, to evaluate whether those factors were still working given the ever-changing business models in the technology space, and to better understand the exposures in my portfolios.• Delivered considerable outperformance for the 4 years ending September, 2012 with 4106 bps. outperformance in technology (156.68% SMCOPIT vs. 115.62% RTY TECH) and 2380 bps outperformance in telecom (81.36% SMCOPTEL vs. 57.56% RTY TELECOM) during a period when GARP style was in favor. Consistent outperformance was more challenging in the 2013-2015 time period when there was a broad rally in more expensive momentum-oriented stocks given a very disciplined process and commitment to own reasonably priced names. ~20% of positions owned at my departure have since been acquired or have been taken private at favorable prices. He’s smart, reliable, and grounded. When he makes a commitment, you can count on him to efficiently deliver quality work. Eric would stand out against most quant analysts on results alone, but what really separates him from his peers are his common sense approach to modeling (applying a big picture fundamental lens to the minutiae of refining a complex model) and his ability to translate mathematical jargon into language that can easily be understood by others in the organization. While he is well-versed in the theory, Eric is not academic in applying it to portfolio management – the focus is squarely on generating the best risk-adjusted returns possible. Eric eludes many of the shortcomings I see in financial services leaders today - although he is a confident decision maker whose conviction has been tested under challenging market conditions, Eric is non-dogmatic and pensive about revising assumptions and reviewing decisions. Neither ego nor political agenda get in the way of his focus on contributing to alpha generation. His transition into our team was seamless and he has brought a great demeanor in addition to his analytic talents. He is tactful and treats everyone in the organization with the same degree of respect. In the business world, there are people that you trust because they are competent and hardworking and there are people that you trust because they are honest and have integrity; Eric Thaller falls into both categories. Melissa Marsden Senior Vice President, Investor Relations and Corporate Communications at Iron Mountain February 1, 2012, Len worked with Melissa but at different companies Over the five years that I have covered ProLogis, Melissa has repeatedly demonstrated herself to be informative, efficient, proactive, and professional. Melissa has a comprehensive understanding of financials and the business environment; and she understands the balance between relevant news-flow and what would be simply noise to investors. On the rare occasion that Melissa does not have the answer to a question at her fingertips, she will get back to you promptly with a comprehensive response. In addition to her strong understanding of all of the relevant issues for investors, Melissa is also a pleasure to interact with and I have greatly enjoyed our conversations. Melissa’s responsiveness did not waiver regardless of whether or not we were invested in the stock, which unfortunately is not always the case. I have really appreciated the chance to learn about ProLogis through Melissa’s presence in its IR department and look forward to the chance to do the same at whatever company she chooses for her next position. Portfolio Manager Company Name Fidelity Investments Dates Employed Jan 2009 – May 2016 Employment Duration 7 yrs 5 mos • Managed concentrated, sector-specific portfolios in the technology, telecommunications, and consumer sectors as part of Fidelity’s multi-manager efforts. Employed a Growth At A Reasonable Price style with a disciplined approach to risk management and portfolio construction. • Emphasized owning higher quality companies with above average growth potential, solid business models across a cycle, defendable market positions, and value creating management teams, most of which were undervalued on a P/CF basis with catalysts to unlock value.• Combined complementary quantitative research with my fundamental approach to further identify opportunities and risks and to best understand which factors have proven to be most successful in my universe over time, to evaluate whether those factors were still working given the ever-changing business models in the technology space, and to better understand the exposures in my portfolios.• Delivered considerable outperformance for the 4 years ending September, 2012 with 4106 bps. outperformance in technology (156.68% SMCOPIT vs. 115.62% RTY TECH) and 2380 bps outperformance in telecom (81.36% SMCOPTEL vs. 57.56% RTY TELECOM) during a period when GARP style was in favor. Consistent outperformance was more challenging in the 2013-2015 time period when there was a broad rally in more expensive momentum-oriented stocks given a very disciplined process and commitment to own reasonably priced names. ~20% of positions owned at my departure have since been acquired or have been taken private at favorable prices. Assistant Portfolio Manager Company Name Fidelity Investments Dates Employed Jun 2007 – Dec 2008 Employment Duration 1 yr 7 mos Location Greater Boston Area • Formulated investment themes and buy/sell/hold recommendations using internal research to help successive diversified portfolio managers on one of our larger small cap funds “narrow the universe”• Monitored and analyzed macro-economic and sector specific trends to determine new areas of opportunity and how our existing holdings would be affected• Regularly provided additional due diligence on existing portfolio companies in order to continuously gauge financial performance of our positions and challenge our internal theses• Developed and maintained detailed financial estimate models for the entire portfolio to help capture upside and downside opportunity for each holding. These models were instrumental in making portfolio construction decisions as well as helping to provide a layer of risk management for the portfolio. More Actions Billy has a account Billy Pidgeon Independent analyst/executive Go Play Research Greater New York City Area 500+ 500+ connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent Billy Pidgeon is an independent analyst and games industry expert, interviewed regularly in print, radio and television and appearing at events as keynote speaker, moderator and panelist. Billy consults for manufacturers, publishers, developers, carriers and retailers on market forecasting, business and marketing strategy. Billy was a senior analyst at Inside Network, where he was principal author of the SOARS social app reports. He previously was senior analyst at M2 Research, a boutique market research firm covering the games industry. He has over twenty years' experience in the electronic entertainment industry, first as a producer and executive producer of console and computer games, followed by extensive experience in research, management and product development specializing in the PC, console and mobile games market. Since becoming a market research analyst with Jupiter Media Metrix in 1999, Billy has authored numerous market research reports, bulletins and articles covering a wide range of game hardware, software, services and technology. His reports have included: tracking and contextualizing enthusiast and mass-market gamer behavior, intention, and purchasing patterns; revenue generated from hardware, software, paid digital download, in-game advertising and transactions (including free to play aka F2P); and distribution, use and development of online and offline games for all dedicated, multipurpose and mobile platforms, single and multiplayer games. Billy began his career in video games in 1988 as a producer for Hi Tech Expressions, a small computer and console software publisher and was hired as an executive producer from 1992 to 1996 for Acclaim Entertainment, one of the leading game publishers worldwide at that time. Specialties: Market research, strategy, production, management, emerging business models, digital distribution, competitive analysis, forecasting, expert witness reports and testimony. More Actions Billy has a account Billy Pidgeon Independent analyst/executive Go Play Research Greater New York City Area 500+ 500+ connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent Billy Pidgeon is an independent analyst and games industry expert, interviewed regularly in print, radio and television and appearing at events as keynote speaker, moderator and panelist. Billy consults for manufacturers, publishers, developers, carriers and retailers on market forecasting, business and marketing strategy. Billy was a senior analyst at Inside Network, where he was principal author of the SOARS social app reports. He previously was senior analyst at M2 Research, a boutique market research firm covering the games industry. He has over twenty years' experience in the electronic entertainment industry, first as a producer and executive producer of console and computer games, followed by extensive experience in research, management and product development specializing in the PC, console and mobile games market. Since becoming a market research analyst with Jupiter Media Metrix in 1999, Billy has authored numerous market research reports, bulletins and articles covering a wide range of game hardware, software, services and technology. His reports have included: tracking and contextualizing enthusiast and mass-market gamer behavior, intention, and purchasing patterns; revenue generated from hardware, software, paid digital download, in-game advertising and transactions (including free to play aka F2P); and distribution, use and development of online and offline games for all dedicated, multipurpose and mobile platforms, single and multiplayer games. Billy began his career in video games in 1988 as a producer for Hi Tech Expressions, a small computer and console software publisher and was hired as an executive producer from 1992 to 1996 for Acclaim Entertainment, one of the leading game publishers worldwide at that time. Specialties: Market research, strategy, production, management, emerging business models, digital distribution, competitive analysis, forecasting, expert witness reports and testimony. More Actions Daniel has a account Daniel Martins Equity Researcher and Investment Strategist | Career Coach and Professional Consultant | Speaker Sell Side Researcher LLC New York University Tampa, Florida 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail ➤ SELL SIDE RESEARCHER CONTACT DETAILS ✉ E-mail: founder@sellsideresearcher.com ⓦ Home Page: www.sellsideresearcher.com ⓕ Facebook: www.facebook.com/sellsideresearcher ⓣ Twitter: @sellsider ➤ DEDICATED TO HELPING PROFESSIONALS START A CAREER IN EQUITY RESEARCH What is equity research like? What does one need to know to break into research? How can a recent MBA or college grad, without prior equity research experience, get a job offer? These are fair questions that I had myself, at one point in my career, for which I found good answers over time. I turned these answers into strategies that I used to help me secure a spot as a sell side equity research associate in NYC. Now, I share the same strategies with other career aspirants. Sell Side Researcher was born in 2015 out of the need to fill a gap for good equity research-specific resources to help career aspirants better prepare for the application process. My flagship services -- the eGuide and eCoach -- teach clients how to prepare and distribute a high-quality application package that yields much better results than the traditional resume and cover letter strategy. ☛ Visit my blog page at www.sellsideresearcher.com/blog ☛ Check out my services page at www.sellsideresearcher.com/our-services ➤ SPECIALTIES ★ Company research ★ Research report writing ★ Financial modeling ★ Relative valuation ★ Stock pitching ★ Interview coaching ★ Career strategies ★ Speaker ➤ 10 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN EQUITY RESEARCH, AUDIT AND FINANCIAL ANALYSIS ➢ I am also the current Head Researcher of independent firm DM Martins Research ➢ Prior to founding Sell Side Researcher, I was a Senior Research Associate at FBR Capital Markets, covering the Communications Equipment and Energy Services sectors. ➢ Prior to FBR, I worked in financial analysis and audit at GE, Nielsen and hedge fund Bridgewater Associates. ➢ I hold an MBA degree from NYU, with an emphasis in Financial Markets and Economics. It’s the closing of a long chapter; a chapter that contains nearly all of my professional life. So many experiences, so many learnings, so many friends, and so many memories over this time - too many to capture in a short note. It has truly been a pleasure getting to know each and every person I’ve work with over this time – both inside Verizon and out. From the early days of youth and multi-cultural marketing, to building and growing VCast, to all the partnership efforts with Facebook/Google/Microsoft/Siri/and many more, to supporting the business with (hopefully) strong venture investments and strategic insights from Silicon Valley - and the start up community at large. I’ve been lucky to work with so many great leaders, who are now great friends. Your leadership will stick with me well past my days at Verizon, and your friendship will hopefully as well. I'll be forever grateful for all of the opportunities Verizon has provided me to learn, grow, and lead. I'll take these lessons and experiences with me throughout my career. And so with this post, I say farewell to Verizon. My next chapter, at Apple, begins on Monday. More Actions Daniel has a account Daniel Martins Equity Researcher and Investment Strategist | Career Coach and Professional Consultant | Speaker Sell Side Researcher LLC New York University Tampa, Florida 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail ➤ SELL SIDE RESEARCHER CONTACT DETAILS ✉ E-mail: founder@sellsideresearcher.com ⓦ Home Page: www.sellsideresearcher.com ⓕ Facebook: www.facebook.com/sellsideresearcher ⓣ Twitter: @sellsider ➤ DEDICATED TO HELPING PROFESSIONALS START A CAREER IN EQUITY RESEARCH What is equity research like? What does one need to know to break into research? How can a recent MBA or college grad, without prior equity research experience, get a job offer? These are fair questions that I had myself, at one point in my career, for which I found good answers over time. I turned these answers into strategies that I used to help me secure a spot as a sell side equity research associate in NYC. Now, I share the same strategies with other career aspirants. Sell Side Researcher was born in 2015 out of the need to fill a gap for good equity research-specific resources to help career aspirants better prepare for the application process. My flagship services -- the eGuide and eCoach -- teach clients how to prepare and distribute a high-quality application package that yields much better results than the traditional resume and cover letter strategy. ☛ Visit my blog page at www.sellsideresearcher.com/blog ☛ Check out my services page at www.sellsideresearcher.com/our-services ➤ SPECIALTIES ★ Company research ★ Research report writing ★ Financial modeling ★ Relative valuation ★ Stock pitching ★ Interview coaching ★ Career strategies ★ Speaker ➤ 10 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN EQUITY RESEARCH, AUDIT AND FINANCIAL ANALYSIS ➢ I am also the current Head Researcher of independent firm DM Martins Research ➢ Prior to founding Sell Side Researcher, I was a Senior Research Associate at FBR Capital Markets, covering the Communications Equipment and Energy Services sectors. ➢ Prior to FBR, I worked in financial analysis and audit at GE, Nielsen and hedge fund Bridgewater Associates. ➢ I hold an MBA degree from NYU, with an emphasis in Financial Markets and Economics. He is responsible for several corporate functions, including M&A strategy and execution, technology licensing, venture capital investments and investor relations. Michael’s strategic leadership has catalyzed Citrix’s transformation from a single-product tactical supplier to a strategic provider of secure application and data delivery solutions that let people work and play from anywhere using any device. Prior to joining Citrix, Michael was Managing Director at BMO Financial Group, where he covered the computer networking and software industries. During his tenure as an equity research analyst, Michael's work was recognized by The Wall Street Journal, Reuters and StarMine. A research analyst turned investment banker, Michael has lead or participated in M&A and financing transactions totaling over $7 billion in cumulative deal value since 1995. Cristinziano started his Wall Street career as a research analyst at Needham & Co. Prior to that he was a Member of Technical Staff at Telcordia Technologies (formerly Bellcore/Bell Labs) contributing to next-generation network standards and software development. Cristinziano earned a Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering from Temple University, a Master of Science in Systems Engineering from the University of Pennsylvania and completed post-graduate studies at Carnegie Mellon University and Harvard Business School. More Actions Matt has a premium account Click to upgrade to Premium Matt Epstein Trusted advisor guiding institutional investors and technology companies on the nuances of the oil & gas industry. Aremet Group, LLC Boston University Questrom School of Business Greater New York City Area 500+ 500+ connections InMail Matt Epstein is a financial expert with over 20 years of experience at leading institutions including Salomon Brothers, Lehman Brothers, Morgan Stanley and Citadel Investment Group. He formed Aremet Energy Consulting to advise oil and gas companies, institutional investors, and commodity trading firms. Most recently, leading satellite and big data companies have engaged Aremet seeking strategic, financial, and marketing advice. With a reputation for integrity and discretion, Mr. Epstein displays a rare, comprehensive, end-to-end fluency in operational, logistical, financial and market risk. He excels navigating complexity, forecasting scenario probability, and formulating strategy. Mr. Epstein regularly demonstrates thought-leadership through his writings and publications. Early in his career as sell­-side, equity-research analyst, he wrote numerous reports covering the oilfield service industry. He has also published in-depth articles on shale development finance, hedging strategy and the negatives of employing zero­-cost collars as a hedging tool in Oil and Gas Investor magazine. Currently, Mr. Epstein posts oil-price insights on LinkedIn Pulse. Mr. Epstein is a United States citizen residing in Greenwich, Connecticut. He earned degrees in 1992 through an honors-five­-year BA/MBA program at Boston University, where he graduated summa cum laude. What a week in US grocery retail! 1. #Aldi kicks it off, announcing plans to invest $3.4bn in adding another 900 stores over the next five years, bringing it to 2,500 stores. 2. #Publix, which has been in and out of #ecommerce for many years, is going all in with #Instacart, and so is #Wegmans, a retailer which is renowned for its outstanding in-store experience and has some of the highest volume stores in the US. 3. #Lidl launches with a format that looks really solid and destined for success. 4. #Amazon tops it off with its plans to acquire Whole Foods Market, transforming both organisations, and impacting the entire sector. 5. And I almost missed #Walmart and its acquisition of Bonobos, continuing its evolution to be a tech-led business. What an amazing time to be working in this industry. More Actions Joel has a account Joel Fishbein Managing Director at BTIG BTIG Widener University School of Law Greater Philadelphia Area 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Plugging the Dam: Understanding the Next Wave of Cyber Threats – and Which Companies Will Capitalize The BTIG software team recently published a comprehensive report entitled “Cyber Security Landscape 2016 and Beyond: Playing the Game of Clones.” This report analyzes the current cyber security vendor landscape and identifies which public and private companies are best positioned as potential “disruptors” from a field that we dub the “clones.” Our analysis is based on hundreds of conversations with public and private companies, security experts, resellers, system integrators, and most importantly, customers. For a copy of the report inbox me at jfishbein@btig.com. Software Report: Evolve or die: Analyzing the impact of Cloud Computing on the IT landscape. While the migration to cloud computing will evolve over time, the disintermediation of legacy IT providers is well underway. Faster innovation cycles and the pay-as-you-go model are clearly resonating and have created a land-grab market. In light of this shift, we are taking this opportunity to examine the current competitive and market landscape, and assess emerging trends affecting the Cloud Computing market, including Cloud Infrastructure, Big Data/Analytics, Cloud Storage, Software Defined Networking, Cloud Platforms, the Social Enterprise, On Demand Software, Cloud Management, Desktop Virtualization, and Mobile Software. Cloud Computing: What's Next: The past year has confirmed our thesis that Cloud Computing is transforming the IT industry. Although cloud technology is still relatively immature, innovation on all layers of the cloud stack is unprecedented. The potential of the cloud to transform IT from capex to opex, improve business agility, and enable self-service is being embraced by customers and legacy vendors. More Actions Joel has a account Joel Fishbein Managing Director at BTIG BTIG Widener University School of Law Greater Philadelphia Area 500+ 500+ connections Send InMail Plugging the Dam: Understanding the Next Wave of Cyber Threats – and Which Companies Will Capitalize The BTIG software team recently published a comprehensive report entitled “Cyber Security Landscape 2016 and Beyond: Playing the Game of Clones.” This report analyzes the current cyber security vendor landscape and identifies which public and private companies are best positioned as potential “disruptors” from a field that we dub the “clones.” Our analysis is based on hundreds of conversations with public and private companies, security experts, resellers, system integrators, and most importantly, customers. For a copy of the report inbox me at jfishbein@btig.com. Software Report: Evolve or die: Analyzing the impact of Cloud Computing on the IT landscape. While the migration to cloud computing will evolve over time, the disintermediation of legacy IT providers is well underway. Faster innovation cycles and the pay-as-you-go model are clearly resonating and have created a land-grab market. In light of this shift, we are taking this opportunity to examine the current competitive and market landscape, and assess emerging trends affecting the Cloud Computing market, including Cloud Infrastructure, Big Data/Analytics, Cloud Storage, Software Defined Networking, Cloud Platforms, the Social Enterprise, On Demand Software, Cloud Management, Desktop Virtualization, and Mobile Software. Cloud Computing: What's Next: The past year has confirmed our thesis that Cloud Computing is transforming the IT industry. Although cloud technology is still relatively immature, innovation on all layers of the cloud stack is unprecedented. The potential of the cloud to transform IT from capex to opex, improve business agility, and enable self-service is being embraced by customers and legacy vendors. Developed and presented an investment philosophy and strategy for the fund to senior management and the board of trustees for approval Education Chartered Financial Analyst Dates attended or expected graduation 1997 University of Wisconsin-Madison Degree Name Master of Science Field Of Study Finance, Investment & Banking Dates attended or expected graduation 1991 – 1993 University of Wisconsin-Madison Degree Name Bachelor of Business Administration Field Of Study Finance and Real Estate Dates attended or expected graduation 1987 – 1991 Featured Skills & Endorsements Investments See 16 endorsements for Investments 16 Investments Endorsed by Mike Marzolf and 1 other who is highly skilled at this Endorsed by 6 of Brian’s colleagues at Thrivent Financial Click and drag to reorder skills Portfolio Management See 13 endorsements for Portfolio Management 13 Portfolio Management Endorsed by Mike Marzolf and 2 others who are highly skilled at this Endorsed by 5 of Brian’s colleagues at Thrivent Financial Click and drag to reorder skills Equities See 12 endorsements for Equities 12 Equities Endorsed by Mike Marzolf, who is highly skilled at this Endorsed by 6 of Brian’s colleagues at Thrivent Financial Click and drag to reorder skills View 26 more View 26 more skills Recommendations Received (4) Given (4) Peter Shouvlin Barton Investment Management December 23, 2014, Brian was a client of Peter’s I highly recommend Brian as an equity portfolio manager. I am an institutional equity sales person and have covered Brian since 1998. He is very knowledgeable about his portfolio companies, always has a detailed grasp of a company’s products and competitive position that few analysts possess. While he does a comprehensive analysis on the companies he is studying, he understands what is relevant to the particular stock and focuses his efforts on the key items. His work leads him to have conviction in his investments, not allowing the day to day trading noise to deter him; an independent thinker, that does not get influenced by the crowd. Brian maintains a strong, consistent investment process focused on key financial metrics such as free cash flow and return on invested capital and looks for management teams that are buying the stock personally, aligning themselves financially with shareholders. He is very disciplined in that if his investment thesis changes (financial metrics deteriorate, management sells stock) he will be quick to reduce and/or exit the position. Given his history of investing across multi sectors, he has a great grasp of risk management in terms of portfolio construction and the importance of proper sector allocation. He is in a class by himself in terms of passion, work ethic and communication skills. David Streit Vice President, Investor and Public Relations at EOG Resources February 1, 2014, Brian worked with David in the same group I worked with Brian for 13 years at Thrivent Asset Management, supporting his team as an equity analyst. Brian is an authentic servant-leader. He is dedicated to supporting those around him and is a charismatic team builder. His stock review sessions brought out the best in everyone, and Brian's rigorous analysis and insightful questions honed each new idea. Brian is an astute stock picker and sharp-eyed prospector of new investment ideas. His enthusiasm and insight into the technology sector stood out, where he was consistently ahead of the curve. Brian also made a mark as a credible and persuasive marketer and one of the best spokespersons for the firm in television and print interviews. He was in high demand as a speaker at Thrivent sales conferences, where he proved adept at cultivating top performing sales agents and high net worth clients. I highly recommend Brian as a leader of high performance teams and widely respected colleague and friend. Paul supported and developed relationships with a number of different portfolio management teams during his tenure at Thrivent. Paul would understand the teams' needs, develop a quantitative process to answer the desired question, and effectively communicate the results to multiple audiences. I enjoyed working with Paul and would highlight that he has a strong work ethic and the utmost intergrity. John Hintz, CFA Head of Investments at Winch Financial October 20, 2013, John worked with Brian in the same group I worked with John for over 15 years at Thrivent. During his tenure, John mastered many skills including credit analysis, equity analysis, corporate strategy and portfolio management. John demonstrated a passionate work ethic that helped improve returns across many of the products at Thrivent. I would highly recommend John as a valuable team member to any organization looking to improve or enhance their analytical capabilities.
